column4: I cannot use any of the programs in the admin menu and i'm the only user. Does anyone know what's wrong?
have you enabled root for some reason?
what?
I was asking if you ever enabled the root password for some reason (ie set a password for root (which you are not supposed to do))
you probably didn't if you can't remember.  So let's assume that's not the problem.  What does the command 'groups' output?
does 'sudo echo hi' output hi?
umm ok hold on, if you can view /etc/sudoers on the other partition, just pastebin that
are you on windows now?
how do you cat /etc/sudoers on windows? (curious)
google 'explore2fs' so you can view the files on your ubuntu partition while you are on windows
ok i got the prog
i got the prog
okay, run it and paste the contents of /etc/sudoers on pastebin please
there doesn't seem to be a dudoers in /etc
are you sure?
right click, there should be an option to read it or copy somewhere
don't paste here!
okay, that's not the problem... what exactly happens when you click on the icon for one of the admin tools.  Does it prompt you for a password?  Do you enter your user password?
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/7487
okay, that's not the problem... what exactly happens when you click on the icon for one of the admin tools?  Does it prompt you for a password?  Do you enter your user password?
but i thought the live disk doesn;t load anything from the hard drive
but i thought the live disk doesn;t load anything from the hard drive
still around?
